communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: VMI Student activities permits
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Discussion during the recent VMI Executive Committe session and in the letter submitted during the public comment period for that session there are repeated references to "permits" in regard to The Cadet newspaper and other activities. During the BOV Maj Gen. Wins stated all "permits" were consistant and in response to Mr. Williams' question on The Cadet Maj. Gen. Wins stated the permit for that organization woulld follow the same model as for other student activities. It was also stated that VMI does not "negotiate" there permits.

I am requesting a copy of all non-athletic student activity "permits" now in effect for student organizations at VMI.  Per the VMI website these include: Arnold Air Society, Aviation Club, Ballroom Dancing, Building Bridges, Coast Guard, Ducks Unlimited, Emergency Response Team, Equestrian, Fire Fighting, Fishing, Glee, Golf, Ethics, Internationa, Jiu-Jitsu, Men In Grey, Motivation, Pistol, Promaji, Ranger, Recon Commpany, Rock Climbing, Scuba, Cadet Life-Holding Account, Cadet Program Board, Coast Guard Club/Naval ROTC, Combat Support Group/Military Skills Group, The Bomb, Theater, Three Gun, Timber Framers, Trap and Skeet, Status Check/Podcast Club, VMI's scholarly journal "Cadence", American Campaigning Warefare, and any others not listed on the website.

I am also requesting a copy of records showing how much non-VMI money each of the student activities received for any outside source and the source of those funds for the current academic year that is in addition to the VMI unds I assume are accurate on this published document. https://www.vmi.edu/media/content-assets/documents/comptroller/Cadet-Activity-Fees-2024-2025.pdf (if not please correct).

Given Maj. Gen. Wins' statement the permit for The Cadet was reviewed against all other permits during its drafting these shoudl be immediately available with little to no search required.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Rogers Park ShotSpotter Contract
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

The most recent contract (i.e. council resolution, contract extension, contract amendments, cure notices, or other revisions to agreements) between Rogers Park area and SoundThinking, Inc., formerly ShotSpotter, Inc.. This document(s) should include the total cost over the life of the contract and the current expiration date.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that fees cannot be waived, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Anthony Lo

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anthony Lo

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Solitary Confinement in 2020
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Subject: Freedom of Information Act Request

Dear Freedom of Information Officer,

I am writing to request information under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) [5 U.S.C. § 552] regarding inmates currently held in solitary confinement within the state of Illinois.

Please provide the following information for each inmate:

1. The total number of inmates held in solitary confinement.
2. The duration for which each inmate has been in solitary confinement.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that fees cannot be waived, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

I look forward to your response within the statutory 20 working day period as outlined in the FOIA.

Thank you for considering my request.

Sincerely,

Anthony Lo

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anthony Lo

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FDA on lecanemab
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

November 3, 2024
Food and Drug Administration
Division of Freedom of Information (HFI-35)

RE:  Freedom of Information Act request

Dear FOIA Officer:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552a, I am requesting all correspondence between FDA agency staff and drug sponsors of Lecanemab (application 761269Orig1s000) including all meeting records/minutes/notes documenting interactions between agency staff and Esai inc. or Biogen personnel regarding the drug, lecanemab (Leqembi) from December 1, 2023 through the present November 3, 2024 related to the following search terms: "deaths" "died" "mortality" "death rate". This should include any references to journalists reporting on Leqembi by FDA agency staff whether or not the communication includes an employee of Eisai or Biogen.

I am a professional journalist writing for The BMJ. 
 
As an investigative journalist, I request a waiver of fees associated with processing this FOIA request and duplicating responsive records.  

Thank you for your attention to this request.

Sincerely,


Jeanne Lenzer

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jeanne Lenzer

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

November 3, 2024
Food and Drug Administration
Division of Freedom of Information (HFI-35)

Expedited Freedom of Information Act request

Dear FOIA Officer:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552a, and under FDA’s expedited processing regulation 21 CFR § 20.44 I am requesting all materials, emails, phone records, logs, as contained in any media format regarding donanemab (Kisunla) BLA # 761248 from communications between FDA and Kisunla's cmanufacturer, Eli Lilly from March 1, 2021 through November 1, 2024. I request such communications in any format including emails, meeting notes or recordings/transcripts whether they are intra-FDA communications or externally with Lilly. I further request any communications between the FDA and Lilly regarding public reporting on Kisunla in any media - please use the search term "BMJ" as well as the "New York Times" and "STAT".  

I am requesting an expedited response as Kisunla has been shown to have a concerning rate of deaths and has been mandated by the FDA to file ongoing death data with the agency and this information is in the public interest and is not reliably available in the public database (FAERS). 

I am a professional journalist writing for The BMJ and other media outlets.
 
As an investigative journalist, I request a waiver of fees associated with processing this FOIA request and duplicating responsive records.  

Thank you for your attention to this request.

Sincerely,


Jeanne Lenzer

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jeanne Lenzer

title: Classification metadata for old records, and classification & declassification guides (Department of the Interior)

communications.communication:
Dear Department of the Interior,

On behalf of myself and Fiat Fiendum, I hereby request the following records under 5 USC 552(a)(3), as to your Department, including every component or otherwise associated agency, corporation, or other establishment of the executive branch within the meaning of 5 USC 552(f)(1):

1. for each record created before Jan. 1, 2016, that was ever classified in whole or in part, a CSV formatted spreadsheet of the following EO 13526 information:
a. a unique record identifier, and location information, sufficient to enable a FOIA officer to easily and precisely locate that record, and that is as descriptive as is feasible without disclosing classified information
b. the date the record was created
c. the classification level and codewords (e.g. "TS/SCI//FISA", "SECRET//ORCON/NOFORN", "TOP SECRET//COMINT//REL TO USA, FVEY",  or the like)
d. the identity of the original classification authority, including their personal identifier, agency, office, position, and name
e. the agency and office of origin
f. the date of original classification
g. the date or event for declassification per EO 13526 § 1.5(a), or the 10–25 year declassification date per § 1.5(b), as the case may be
h. the concise reason for classification
i. the applicable classifications categories from EO 13526 § 1.4
j. the  associated "classification guide" and/or "declassification guide" within the meaning of EO 13526 § 6.1(h) & (n), or if those are separate full documents rather than relatively short text, their record unique identifiers
k. EO 13526 § 1.6(a)(1)(D) information (in the case of information that should clearly and demonstrably be expected to reveal the identity of a confidential human source or a human intelligence source or key design concepts of weapons of mass destruction, the marking prescribed in implementing directives issued pursuant to EO 13526)
l. EO 13526 § 3.3(b), (c), (d), (g), (h), (i), & (j) information (automatic declassification exemption), including the particular subparagraphs claimed to be applicable, and the applicable details (such as explanations of exemption, date exempted, exempting authority, etc)
m. all other classification metadata, such as "derived from" markers (see e.g. EO 13526 § 2.1), foreign classifications (see e.g. EO 13526 § 1.6(e)), etc.
n. the FOIA identifiers of every request made which covered that record

2. all classification guides within the meaning of EO 13526 §§ 6.1(h), together with their unique record identifiers
3. all declassification guides within the meaning of EO 13526 §§ 6.1(n), together with their unique record identifiers


For item 1, to the extent that you are unable to narrow your search based on the age of the underlying records, please either substitute the text "created before Jan. 1, 2016" with "classified before Jan. 1, 2016" or ignore the text ", created before Jan. 1, 2016" — i.e. you may construe the relevant date as the date of classification rather than the date of record creation (if you don't have the latter but have the former), and you may have false positives (additionally disclosing the classification metadata of records that are from 2016 or later), but you may not have false negatives (failing to disclose exemptions about records that are from before 2016, e.g. because your search fails to include classification metadata about records whose creation date you didn't track).

To the extent that you do not have item 1 records in a spreadsheet or database format, please provide records that would most closely approximate it — i.e. comprising a bulk index of classification information that would be useful for making FOIA requests of records whose classification has expired — such as (in decreasing order of preference) records compiled for the purpose of conducting (or for the then-future conduction of) declassification or declassification review under EO 13526, such as §§ 3.3, 3.4, 3.5, or 3.6 automatic, systematic, or mandatory declassification; classification logs; record indices; record cover sheets; or the like.

This request has no time or subject limit whatsoever, other than that the cutoff date is the date of your search.

For all responsive records, I request:
a. all parts of the record (i.e. no portion of a record with some responsive portion may be considered "non-responsive")
b. all record metadata, such as dates on which they were drafted, passed, went into effect, withdrawn, or similar events; person(s) / office(s) responsible; authors; IDs; revision numbers; email headers; hyperlinks; structural metadata; email addresses; comments; revision history; timestamps; file names and contents; pagination or lack thereof; format specific metadata (e.g. particular to Word, PDF, or paper files); filing location, labeling, & organization; etc.
c. if any classification applies, mandatory declassification review (MDR) under E.O. 13526, and the result of the MDR, including any declassified records.



# Form & format

## Native email format & minimal redaction

Please provide all email records in EML, Maildir, or MBOX format only — not PDF, Word, image, etc — including all metadata (e.g. full email headers as received/sent) and attachments, without alteration other than narrowly tailored electronic redaction of specifically claimed exemptions that do not affect any part of non exempt information (and, in particular, without rasterization).

Please provide all other records in their original electronic format (if electronic), and as one 300dpi color scan PDF per logical document, staple, paperclip, or file folder (whichever is most narrow) if the original is in paper format.

Please note that FOIA requires you to service the maximum extent of my request that can be done via e.g. partial redaction of exempt material. If you believe some portions of a record to be exempt because it contains classified information (18 USC 798), please provide a version of the record redacted to the minimum extent necessary to remove exempt information, along with adequate information to describe the reason for each specific exemption, and without altering any non exempt information (including metadata).

## No new records; electronic & original format

This request does not ask you to create new records.

If you determine that a response would require creating a new record that you do not want to create, please first contact me by email with an explanation of what records you have that would most closely match the information requested and might be acceptable substitutes, so that we can reasonably tailor the request.

In particular, I specifically request that you do not create new documents in response to this request that are modifications of a digital record, such as page-view images, print views, scans, or the like. No such creation or substitution is authorized by FOIA.

However, if the same or similar records are held in both electronic and paper formats, this request includes both the paper and electronic versions. The paper version and the digital version are distinct records, and each may contain distinct information such as handwritten or other markings on the paper copy and embedded metadata in the electronic version. I specifically request both the original, electronic format record, and (if it contains any additional markings) the paper record.

To the extent that the original native electronic format is proprietary or otherwise not in format accessible by widely available, open source software, I also request
1. an export of the proprietary format into a standard, open format, and
2. all proprietary software and documentation necessary to use and understand the original, proprietary format records.

## Rehab Act § 508 compliance

I am partially blind. In accordance with 5 USC 552(a)(3)(B & C) (E-FOIA), Rehabilitation Act § 508, and the FOIA Improvement Act, I require that you respond using original, native format, electronic, machine-processable, accessible, open, and well structured records to the maximum extent possible — for both the content of your response, and any communications about the request (such as response letters).

Please make all correspondence pursuant to this request — including notification and responsive records — by email, with native electronic format records, as specified in the request. I do not authorize you to send anything to me by physical mail unless I specifically state otherwise.

## Compression, passwords, and uploading large files

Multiple files may be sent in a combined, compressed form using standard ZIP, TAR, GZIP, BZIP2, and/or RAR formats, or sent as separate files, at your discretion.

Do not use any password on any files, including ZIP files etc., unless a password was present in the original, native format (in which case, leave it unaltered, and send me the password). Do not respond using ZixCorp "Secure Mail" or any other method that "expires" records from being available. Use only actual email and direct attachments, or upload using the link below, unless I explicitly request otherwise.

If there are any files you prefer not to transfer by email (e.g. if they are >10MB), please upload them to me via the link listed below my signature. Doing so is secure, completely free to you, and I will be notified of the upload. If that is insufficient, I can also provide Google Drive, Dropbox, SFTP, rsync, or similar provisions that will let you easily upload hundreds of gigabytes of data to me for free.

## Redaction of repeatedly occurring content

When redacting any content that appears more than once in the full set of responsive records, please assign a replacement identifier for each, so that your redaction does not obfuscate the commonality.

For example, suppose that responsive records include the names Alice, Bob, and Chris, and you determine that each of those names are redactable (e.g. under (b)(7) or (b)(6)). Rather than redacting each with only the text "(b)(7)(C)", replace each instance of "Alice" with "(b)(7)(D) - confidential source 1", each instance of "Bob" with "(b)(7)(C) - US congressional aide 2", each instance of "Chris" with "(b)(7)(C) - US congressional aide 3",  etc. This would vindicate your narrow interest in withholding the person's identity, while not withholding the facts of commonality between occurrences, nor the relevant natures of each redacted person, which you would not have justification to withhold.

Please use reasonably descriptive identifiers. For instance, if Alice's name is not redacted but her personal cellphone number is, and that cellphone number appears e.g. both in her email signature and elsewhere by itself, it should in both cases be redacted with the same descriptive identifier, such as "Alice's cell #" (or "confidential source 1's cell #" if her name is redacted, as above). 

Please use a unique replacement identifier number for each distinct item — e.g. even if you only redact two entities, and they have different descriptors such that the descriptors would distinguish them, use "confidential source 1" and "US congressional aide 2", not "US congressional aide 1". The result should be that there is exactly one replacement identifier number per identical redacted content, across all records produced, with no reuse of the same number for different content, nor use of different numbers for the same content — except for the purposes of descriptive reference, e.g. the "2" in "confidential source 1 email to US congressional aide 2".

If a classification codeword is itself classified — meaning very specifically the text of that codeword, e.g. if the literal texts "STLW" and/or "STELLARWIND" were themselves classified, not merely their expansions, referents, or covered records —  please use a replacement like "TSC 4" or "SC 5" (as applicable). Likewise, if the existence of a particular classification authority office is classified, please use a replacement like "NSA office 6". Etc.

For PDFs, replacement identifiers can be specified in the margins if they don't fit in the original space. For more native electronic files, like EML, this can be done by direct editing. If space or file format does not permit you to do so inline or in margins or equivalent, then please use just the replacement identifier number (e.g. "[#52]"), and provide a CSV formatted table matching replacement identifier numbers to full replacement identifiers with your response letter.

If you make any such redactions, please keep but do not provide a table matching codes/identifiers to the redacted content, for use in case your redaction is examined or overturned on appeal or in litigation.

This is a form and format request pertaining to your process of redaction. Because it only applies in situations when you have already exercised the voluntary decision to alter the records from the original form requested, you have necessarily waived any objection to this section "creating a new record", since your act of redaction itself already "makes a new record" in that limited sense. This is only about how you do a redaction you have already decided to make.

This provision limits the scope of your redaction to the minimum possible extent, and specifies the form and format of your redactions, so that even if you decide to withhold some particular piece of content, you do not also withhold the fact of its being the same as the same content appearing elsewhere, or the kind of thing redacted. That fact is itself metadata that is explicitly requested as part of this request. If you decide that the mere fact of two pieces of content being the same is itself withholdable, then please redact it using a replacement identifier that encodes only the reason.


# Rolling updates

Please provide me with rolling (incremental) updates, rather than having the entirety of the request be blocked until fully completed.

Please preserve all responsive records that you currently hold, pending release, particularly ones that are currently held in electronic form or format.

Please prioritize rolling updates based on what is most readily available, i.e. such that you release as the greatest amount of records in the fastest time.


# Fee waiver

I request fee waiver, because
* Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit;
* this request is for public interest, non-commercial, journalistic purposes;
* EO 13526 requires you to already be automatically and systematically compiling and acting on the records in item 1, and to centrally store the records in items 1 & 2;
* I am requesting records to be provided exclusively in electronic format, with no paper copies, so you should incur no actual costs; and
* the President determined in EO 13526 that 10–25 year old classified records should be declassified, and the records requested would serve as an index for a follow-up request for all such records, to make them widely available.


# Request tracking numbers and estimated completion date

Upon receipt, and in every followup response, please state your tracking number(s) for this request, as well as your specific estimated completion date. 5 USC 552(a)(7).


Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your initial response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.
Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) tax-exempt corporation devoted to public interest journalism, government transparency and accountability, individuals' civil rights, and related issues.

P.S. My full legal name is just Sai. Please use no title for me.

e. the agency and office of origin
f. the date of original classification
g. the date or event for declassification per EO 13526 § 1.5(a), or the 10–25 year declassification date per § 1.5(b), as the case may be
h. the concise reason for classification
i. the applicable classifications categories from EO 13526 § 1.4
j. the  associated "classification guide" and/or "declassification guide" within the meaning of EO 13526 § 6.1(h) & (n), or if those are separate full documents rather than relatively short text, their record unique identifiers
k. EO 13526 § 1.6(a)(1)(D) information (in the case of information that should clearly and demonstrably be expected to reveal the identity of a confidential human source or a human intelligence source or key design concepts of weapons of mass destruction, the marking prescribed in implementing directives issued pursuant to EO 13526)
l. EO 13526 § 3.3(b), (c), (d), (g), (h), (i), & (j) information (automatic declassification exemption), including the particular subparagraphs claimed to be applicable, and the applicable details (such as explanations of exemption, date exempted, exempting authority, etc)
m. all other classification metadata, such as "derived from" markers (see e.g. EO 13526 § 2.1), foreign classifications (see e.g. EO 13526 § 1.6(e)), etc.
n. the FOIA identifiers of every request made which covered that record

2. all classification guides within the meaning of EO 13526 §§ 6.1(h), together with their unique record identifiers
3. all declassification guides within the meaning of EO 13526 §§ 6.1(n), together with their unique record identifiers


For item 1, to the extent that you are unable to narrow your search based on the age of the underlying records, please either substitute the text "created before Jan. 1, 2016" with "classified before Jan. 1, 2016" or ignore the text ", created before Jan. 1, 2016" — i.e. you may construe the relevant date as the date of classification rather than the date of record creation (if you don't have the latter but have the former), and you may have false positives (additionally disclosing the classification metadata of records that are from 2016 or later), but you may not have false negatives (failing to disclose exemptions about records that are from before 2016, e.g. because your search fails to include classification metadata about records whose creation date you didn't track).

To the extent that you do not have item 1 records in a spreadsheet or database format, please provide records that would most closely approximate it — i.e. comprising a bulk index of classification information that would be useful for making FOIA requests of records whose classification has expired — such as (in decreasing order of preference) records compiled for the purpose of conducting (or for the then-future conduction of) declassification or declassification review under EO 13526, such as §§ 3.3, 3.4, 3.5, or 3.6 automatic, systematic, or mandatory declassification; classification logs; record indices; record cover sheets; or the like.

This request has no time or subject limit whatsoever, other than that the cutoff date is the date of your search.

For all responsive records, I request:
a. all parts of the record (i.e. no portion of a record with some responsive portion may be considered "non-responsive")
b. all record metadata, such as dates on which they were drafted, passed, went into effect, withdrawn, or similar events; person(s) / office(s) responsible; authors; IDs; revision numbers; email headers; hyperlinks; structural metadata; email addresses; comments; revision history; timestamps; file names and contents; pagination or lack thereof; format specific metadata (e.g. particular to Word, PDF, or paper files); filing location, labeling, & organization; etc.
c. if any classification applies, mandatory declassification review (MDR) under E.O. 13526, and the result of the MDR, including any declassified records.



# Form & format

## Native email format & minimal redaction

Please provide all email records in EML, Maildir, or MBOX format only — not PDF, Word, image, etc — including all metadata (e.g. full email headers as received/sent) and attachments, without alteration other than narrowly tailored electronic redaction of specifically claimed exemptions that do not affect any part of non exempt information (and, in particular, without rasterization).

Please provide all other records in their original electronic format (if electronic), and as one 300dpi color scan PDF per logical document, staple, paperclip, or file folder (whichever is most narrow) if the original is in paper format.

Please note that FOIA requires you to service the maximum extent of my request that can be done via e.g. partial redaction of exempt material. If you believe some portions of a record to be exempt because it contains classified information (18 USC 798), please provide a version of the record redacted to the minimum extent necessary to remove exempt information, along with adequate information to describe the reason for each specific exemption, and without altering any non exempt information (including metadata).

## No new records; electronic & original format

This request does not ask you to create new records.

If you determine that a response would require creating a new record that you do not want to create, please first contact me by email with an explanation of what records you have that would most closely match the information requested and might be acceptable substitutes, so that we can reasonably tailor the request.

In particular, I specifically request that you do not create new documents in response to this request that are modifications of a digital record, such as page-view images, print views, scans, or the like. No such creation or substitution is authorized by FOIA.

However, if the same or similar records are held in both electronic and paper formats, this request includes both the paper and electronic versions. The paper version and the digital version are distinct records, and each may contain distinct information such as handwritten or other markings on the paper copy and embedded metadata in the electronic version. I specifically request both the original, electronic format record, and (if it contains any additional markings) the paper record.

To the extent that the original native electronic format is proprietary or otherwise not in format accessible by widely available, open source software, I also request
1. an export of the proprietary format into a standard, open format, and
2. all proprietary software and documentation necessary to use and understand the original, proprietary format records.

## Rehab Act § 508 compliance

I am partially blind. In accordance with 5 USC 552(a)(3)(B & C) (E-FOIA), Rehabilitation Act § 508, and the FOIA Improvement Act, I require that you respond using original, native format, electronic, machine-processable, accessible, open, and well structured records to the maximum extent possible — for both the content of your response, and any communications about the request (such as response letters).

Please make all correspondence pursuant to this request — including notification and responsive records — by email, with native electronic format records, as specified in the request. I do not authorize you to send anything to me by physical mail unless I specifically state otherwise.

## Compression, passwords, and uploading large files

Multiple files may be sent in a combined, compressed form using standard ZIP, TAR, GZIP, BZIP2, and/or RAR formats, or sent as separate files, at your discretion.

Do not use any password on any files, including ZIP files etc., unless a password was present in the original, native format (in which case, leave it unaltered, and send me the password). Do not respond using ZixCorp "Secure Mail" or any other method that "expires" records from being available. Use only actual email and direct attachments, or upload using the link below, unless I explicitly request otherwise.

If there are any files you prefer not to transfer by email (e.g. if they are >10MB), please upload them to me via the link listed below my signature. Doing so is secure, completely free to you, and I will be notified of the upload. If that is insufficient, I can also provide Google Drive, Dropbox, SFTP, rsync, or similar provisions that will let you easily upload hundreds of gigabytes of data to me for free.

## Redaction of repeatedly occurring content

When redacting any content that appears more than once in the full set of responsive records, please assign a replacement identifier for each, so that your redaction does not obfuscate the commonality.

For example, suppose that responsive records include the names Alice, Bob, and Chris, and you determine that each of those names are redactable (e.g. under (b)(7) or (b)(6)). Rather than redacting each with only the text "(b)(7)(C)", replace each instance of "Alice" with "(b)(7)(D) - confidential source 1", each instance of "Bob" with "(b)(7)(C) - US congressional aide 2", each instance of "Chris" with "(b)(7)(C) - US congressional aide 3",  etc. This would vindicate your narrow interest in withholding the person's identity, while not withholding the facts of commonality between occurrences, nor the relevant natures of each redacted person, which you would not have justification to withhold.

Please use reasonably descriptive identifiers. For instance, if Alice's name is not redacted but her personal cellphone number is, and that cellphone number appears e.g. both in her email signature and elsewhere by itself, it should in both cases be redacted with the same descriptive identifier, such as "Alice's cell #" (or "confidential source 1's cell #" if her name is redacted, as above). 

Please use a unique replacement identifier number for each distinct item — e.g. even if you only redact two entities, and they have different descriptors such that the descriptors would distinguish them, use "confidential source 1" and "US congressional aide 2", not "US congressional aide 1". The result should be that there is exactly one replacement identifier number per identical redacted content, across all records produced, with no reuse of the same number for different content, nor use of different numbers for the same content — except for the purposes of descriptive reference, e.g. the "2" in "confidential source 1 email to US congressional aide 2".

If a classification codeword is itself classified — meaning very specifically the text of that codeword, e.g. if the literal texts "STLW" and/or "STELLARWIND" were themselves classified, not merely their expansions, referents, or covered records —  please use a replacement like "TSC 4" or "SC 5" (as applicable). Likewise, if the existence of a particular classification authority office is classified, please use a replacement like "NSA office 6". Etc.

For PDFs, replacement identifiers can be specified in the margins if they don't fit in the original space. For more native electronic files, like EML, this can be done by direct editing. If space or file format does not permit you to do so inline or in margins or equivalent, then please use just the replacement identifier number (e.g. "[#52]"), and provide a CSV formatted table matching replacement identifier numbers to full replacement identifiers with your response letter.

If you make any such redactions, please keep but do not provide a table matching codes/identifiers to the redacted content, for use in case your redaction is examined or overturned on appeal or in litigation.

This is a form and format request pertaining to your process of redaction. Because it only applies in situations when you have already exercised the voluntary decision to alter the records from the original form requested, you have necessarily waived any objection to this section "creating a new record", since your act of redaction itself already "makes a new record" in that limited sense. This is only about how you do a redaction you have already decided to make.

This provision limits the scope of your redaction to the minimum possible extent, and specifies the form and format of your redactions, so that even if you decide to withhold some particular piece of content, you do not also withhold the fact of its being the same as the same content appearing elsewhere, or the kind of thing redacted. That fact is itself metadata that is explicitly requested as part of this request. If you decide that the mere fact of two pieces of content being the same is itself withholdable, then please redact it using a replacement identifier that encodes only the reason.


# Rolling updates

Please provide me with rolling (incremental) updates, rather than having the entirety of the request be blocked until fully completed.

Please preserve all responsive records that you currently hold, pending release, particularly ones that are currently held in electronic form or format.

Please prioritize rolling updates based on what is most readily available, i.e. such that you release as the greatest amount of records in the fastest time.


# Fee waiver

I request fee waiver, because
* Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit;
* this request is for public interest, non-commercial, journalistic purposes;
* EO 13526 requires you to already be automatically and systematically compiling and acting on the records in item 1, and to centrally store the records in items 1 & 2;
* I am requesting records to be provided exclusively in electronic format, with no paper copies, so you should incur no actual costs; and
* the President determined in EO 13526 that 10–25 year old classified records should be declassified, and the records requested would serve as an index for a follow-up request for all such records, to make them widely available.


# Request tracking numbers and estimated completion date

Upon receipt, and in every followup response, please state your tracking number(s) for this request, as well as your specific estimated completion date. 5 USC 552(a)(7).


Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your initial response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.
Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) tax-exempt corporation devoted to public interest journalism, government transparency and accountability, individuals' civil rights, and related issues.

P.S. My full legal name is just Sai. Please use no title for me.

Please provide all email records in EML, Maildir, or MBOX format only — not PDF, Word, image, etc — including all metadata (e.g. full email headers as received/sent) and attachments, without alteration other than narrowly tailored electronic redaction of specifically claimed exemptions that do not affect any part of non exempt information (and, in particular, without rasterization).

Please provide all other records in their original electronic format (if electronic), and as one 300dpi color scan PDF per logical document, staple, paperclip, or file folder (whichever is most narrow) if the original is in paper format.

Please note that FOIA requires you to service the maximum extent of my request that can be done via e.g. partial redaction of exempt material. If you believe some portions of a record to be exempt because it contains classified information (18 USC 798), please provide a version of the record redacted to the minimum extent necessary to remove exempt information, along with adequate information to describe the reason for each specific exemption, and without altering any non exempt information (including metadata).

## No new records; electronic & original format

This request does not ask you to create new records.

If you determine that a response would require creating a new record that you do not want to create, please first contact me by email with an explanation of what records you have that would most closely match the information requested and might be acceptable substitutes, so that we can reasonably tailor the request.

In particular, I specifically request that you do not create new documents in response to this request that are modifications of a digital record, such as page-view images, print views, scans, or the like. No such creation or substitution is authorized by FOIA.

However, if the same or similar records are held in both electronic and paper formats, this request includes both the paper and electronic versions. The paper version and the digital version are distinct records, and each may contain distinct information such as handwritten or other markings on the paper copy and embedded metadata in the electronic version. I specifically request both the original, electronic format record, and (if it contains any additional markings) the paper record.

To the extent that the original native electronic format is proprietary or otherwise not in format accessible by widely available, open source software, I also request
1. an export of the proprietary format into a standard, open format, and
2. all proprietary software and documentation necessary to use and understand the original, proprietary format records.

## Rehab Act § 508 compliance

I am partially blind. In accordance with 5 USC 552(a)(3)(B & C) (E-FOIA), Rehabilitation Act § 508, and the FOIA Improvement Act, I require that you respond using original, native format, electronic, machine-processable, accessible, open, and well structured records to the maximum extent possible — for both the content of your response, and any communications about the request (such as response letters).

Please make all correspondence pursuant to this request — including notification and responsive records — by email, with native electronic format records, as specified in the request. I do not authorize you to send anything to me by physical mail unless I specifically state otherwise.

## Compression, passwords, and uploading large files

Multiple files may be sent in a combined, compressed form using standard ZIP, TAR, GZIP, BZIP2, and/or RAR formats, or sent as separate files, at your discretion.

Do not use any password on any files, including ZIP files etc., unless a password was present in the original, native format (in which case, leave it unaltered, and send me the password). Do not respond using ZixCorp "Secure Mail" or any other method that "expires" records from being available. Use only actual email and direct attachments, or upload using the link below, unless I explicitly request otherwise.

If there are any files you prefer not to transfer by email (e.g. if they are >10MB), please upload them to me via the link listed below my signature. Doing so is secure, completely free to you, and I will be notified of the upload. If that is insufficient, I can also provide Google Drive, Dropbox, SFTP, rsync, or similar provisions that will let you easily upload hundreds of gigabytes of data to me for free.

## Redaction of repeatedly occurring content

When redacting any content that appears more than once in the full set of responsive records, please assign a replacement identifier for each, so that your redaction does not obfuscate the commonality.

For example, suppose that responsive records include the names Alice, Bob, and Chris, and you determine that each of those names are redactable (e.g. under (b)(7) or (b)(6)). Rather than redacting each with only the text "(b)(7)(C)", replace each instance of "Alice" with "(b)(7)(D) - confidential source 1", each instance of "Bob" with "(b)(7)(C) - US congressional aide 2", each instance of "Chris" with "(b)(7)(C) - US congressional aide 3",  etc. This would vindicate your narrow interest in withholding the person's identity, while not withholding the facts of commonality between occurrences, nor the relevant natures of each redacted person, which you would not have justification to withhold.

Please use reasonably descriptive identifiers. For instance, if Alice's name is not redacted but her personal cellphone number is, and that cellphone number appears e.g. both in her email signature and elsewhere by itself, it should in both cases be redacted with the same descriptive identifier, such as "Alice's cell #" (or "confidential source 1's cell #" if her name is redacted, as above). 

Please use a unique replacement identifier number for each distinct item — e.g. even if you only redact two entities, and they have different descriptors such that the descriptors would distinguish them, use "confidential source 1" and "US congressional aide 2", not "US congressional aide 1". The result should be that there is exactly one replacement identifier number per identical redacted content, across all records produced, with no reuse of the same number for different content, nor use of different numbers for the same content — except for the purposes of descriptive reference, e.g. the "2" in "confidential source 1 email to US congressional aide 2".

If a classification codeword is itself classified — meaning very specifically the text of that codeword, e.g. if the literal texts "STLW" and/or "STELLARWIND" were themselves classified, not merely their expansions, referents, or covered records —  please use a replacement like "TSC 4" or "SC 5" (as applicable). Likewise, if the existence of a particular classification authority office is classified, please use a replacement like "NSA office 6". Etc.

For PDFs, replacement identifiers can be specified in the margins if they don't fit in the original space. For more native electronic files, like EML, this can be done by direct editing. If space or file format does not permit you to do so inline or in margins or equivalent, then please use just the replacement identifier number (e.g. "[#52]"), and provide a CSV formatted table matching replacement identifier numbers to full replacement identifiers with your response letter.

If you make any such redactions, please keep but do not provide a table matching codes/identifiers to the redacted content, for use in case your redaction is examined or overturned on appeal or in litigation.

This is a form and format request pertaining to your process of redaction. Because it only applies in situations when you have already exercised the voluntary decision to alter the records from the original form requested, you have necessarily waived any objection to this section "creating a new record", since your act of redaction itself already "makes a new record" in that limited sense. This is only about how you do a redaction you have already decided to make.

This provision limits the scope of your redaction to the minimum possible extent, and specifies the form and format of your redactions, so that even if you decide to withhold some particular piece of content, you do not also withhold the fact of its being the same as the same content appearing elsewhere, or the kind of thing redacted. That fact is itself metadata that is explicitly requested as part of this request. If you decide that the mere fact of two pieces of content being the same is itself withholdable, then please redact it using a replacement identifier that encodes only the reason.


# Rolling updates

Please provide me with rolling (incremental) updates, rather than having the entirety of the request be blocked until fully completed.

Please preserve all responsive records that you currently hold, pending release, particularly ones that are currently held in electronic form or format.

Please prioritize rolling updates based on what is most readily available, i.e. such that you release as the greatest amount of records in the fastest time.


# Fee waiver

I request fee waiver, because
* Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit;
* this request is for public interest, non-commercial, journalistic purposes;
* EO 13526 requires you to already be automatically and systematically compiling and acting on the records in item 1, and to centrally store the records in items 1 & 2;
* I am requesting records to be provided exclusively in electronic format, with no paper copies, so you should incur no actual costs; and
* the President determined in EO 13526 that 10–25 year old classified records should be declassified, and the records requested would serve as an index for a follow-up request for all such records, to make them widely available.


# Request tracking numbers and estimated completion date

Upon receipt, and in every followup response, please state your tracking number(s) for this request, as well as your specific estimated completion date. 5 USC 552(a)(7).


Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your initial response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.
Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) tax-exempt corporation devoted to public interest journalism, government transparency and accountability, individuals' civil rights, and related issues.

P.S. My full legal name is just Sai. Please use no title for me.

title: Classification metadata for old records, and classification & declassification guides (U.S. Department of State)

communications.communication:
Dear U.S. Department of State,

On behalf of myself and Fiat Fiendum, I hereby request the following records under 5 USC 552(a)(3), as to your Department, including every component or otherwise associated agency, corporation, or other establishment of the executive branch within the meaning of 5 USC 552(f)(1):

1. for each record created before Jan. 1, 2016, that was ever classified in whole or in part, a CSV formatted spreadsheet of the following EO 13526 information:
a. a unique record identifier, and location information, sufficient to enable a FOIA officer to easily and precisely locate that record, and that is as descriptive as is feasible without disclosing classified information
b. the date the record was created
c. the classification level and codewords (e.g. "TS/SCI//FISA", "SECRET//ORCON/NOFORN", "TOP SECRET//COMINT//REL TO USA, FVEY",  or the like)
d. the identity of the original classification authority, including their personal identifier, agency, office, position, and name
e. the agency and office of origin
f. the date of original classification
g. the date or event for declassification per EO 13526 § 1.5(a), or the 10–25 year declassification date per § 1.5(b), as the case may be
h. the concise reason for classification
i. the applicable classifications categories from EO 13526 § 1.4
j. the  associated "classification guide" and/or "declassification guide" within the meaning of EO 13526 § 6.1(h) & (n), or if those are separate full documents rather than relatively short text, their record unique identifiers
k. EO 13526 § 1.6(a)(1)(D) information (in the case of information that should clearly and demonstrably be expected to reveal the identity of a confidential human source or a human intelligence source or key design concepts of weapons of mass destruction, the marking prescribed in implementing directives issued pursuant to EO 13526)
l. EO 13526 § 3.3(b), (c), (d), (g), (h), (i), & (j) information (automatic declassification exemption), including the particular subparagraphs claimed to be applicable, and the applicable details (such as explanations of exemption, date exempted, exempting authority, etc)
m. all other classification metadata, such as "derived from" markers (see e.g. EO 13526 § 2.1), foreign classifications (see e.g. EO 13526 § 1.6(e)), etc.
n. the FOIA identifiers of every request made which covered that record

2. all classification guides within the meaning of EO 13526 §§ 6.1(h), together with their unique record identifiers
3. all declassification guides within the meaning of EO 13526 §§ 6.1(n), together with their unique record identifiers


For item 1, to the extent that you are unable to narrow your search based on the age of the underlying records, please either substitute the text "created before Jan. 1, 2016" with "classified before Jan. 1, 2016" or ignore the text ", created before Jan. 1, 2016" — i.e. you may construe the relevant date as the date of classification rather than the date of record creation (if you don't have the latter but have the former), and you may have false positives (additionally disclosing the classification metadata of records that are from 2016 or later), but you may not have false negatives (failing to disclose exemptions about records that are from before 2016, e.g. because your search fails to include classification metadata about records whose creation date you didn't track).

To the extent that you do not have item 1 records in a spreadsheet or database format, please provide records that would most closely approximate it — i.e. comprising a bulk index of classification information that would be useful for making FOIA requests of records whose classification has expired — such as (in decreasing order of preference) records compiled for the purpose of conducting (or for the then-future conduction of) declassification or declassification review under EO 13526, such as §§ 3.3, 3.4, 3.5, or 3.6 automatic, systematic, or mandatory declassification; classification logs; record indices; record cover sheets; or the like.

This request has no time or subject limit whatsoever, other than that the cutoff date is the date of your search.

For all responsive records, I request:
a. all parts of the record (i.e. no portion of a record with some responsive portion may be considered "non-responsive")
b. all record metadata, such as dates on which they were drafted, passed, went into effect, withdrawn, or similar events; person(s) / office(s) responsible; authors; IDs; revision numbers; email headers; hyperlinks; structural metadata; email addresses; comments; revision history; timestamps; file names and contents; pagination or lack thereof; format specific metadata (e.g. particular to Word, PDF, or paper files); filing location, labeling, & organization; etc.
c. if any classification applies, mandatory declassification review (MDR) under E.O. 13526, and the result of the MDR, including any declassified records.

For example, suppose that responsive records include the names Alice, Bob, and Chris, and you determine that each of those names are redactable (e.g. under (b)(7) or (b)(6)). Rather than redacting each with only the text "(b)(7)(C)", replace each instance of "Alice" with "(b)(7)(D) - confidential source 1", each instance of "Bob" with "(b)(7)(C) - US congressional aide 2", each instance of "Chris" with "(b)(7)(C) - US congressional aide 3",  etc. This would vindicate your narrow interest in withholding the person's identity, while not withholding the facts of commonality between occurrences, nor the relevant natures of each redacted person, which you would not have justification to withhold.

Please use reasonably descriptive identifiers. For instance, if Alice's name is not redacted but her personal cellphone number is, and that cellphone number appears e.g. both in her email signature and elsewhere by itself, it should in both cases be redacted with the same descriptive identifier, such as "Alice's cell #" (or "confidential source 1's cell #" if her name is redacted, as above). 

Please use a unique replacement identifier number for each distinct item — e.g. even if you only redact two entities, and they have different descriptors such that the descriptors would distinguish them, use "confidential source 1" and "US congressional aide 2", not "US congressional aide 1". The result should be that there is exactly one replacement identifier number per identical redacted content, across all records produced, with no reuse of the same number for different content, nor use of different numbers for the same content — except for the purposes of descriptive reference, e.g. the "2" in "confidential source 1 email to US congressional aide 2".

If a classification codeword is itself classified — meaning very specifically the text of that codeword, e.g. if the literal texts "STLW" and/or "STELLARWIND" were themselves classified, not merely their expansions, referents, or covered records —  please use a replacement like "TSC 4" or "SC 5" (as applicable). Likewise, if the existence of a particular classification authority office is classified, please use a replacement like "NSA office 6". Etc.

For PDFs, replacement identifiers can be specified in the margins if they don't fit in the original space. For more native electronic files, like EML, this can be done by direct editing. If space or file format does not permit you to do so inline or in margins or equivalent, then please use just the replacement identifier number (e.g. "[#52]"), and provide a CSV formatted table matching replacement identifier numbers to full replacement identifiers with your response letter.

If you make any such redactions, please keep but do not provide a table matching codes/identifiers to the redacted content, for use in case your redaction is examined or overturned on appeal or in litigation.

This is a form and format request pertaining to your process of redaction. Because it only applies in situations when you have already exercised the voluntary decision to alter the records from the original form requested, you have necessarily waived any objection to this section "creating a new record", since your act of redaction itself already "makes a new record" in that limited sense. This is only about how you do a redaction you have already decided to make.

This provision limits the scope of your redaction to the minimum possible extent, and specifies the form and format of your redactions, so that even if you decide to withhold some particular piece of content, you do not also withhold the fact of its being the same as the same content appearing elsewhere, or the kind of thing redacted. That fact is itself metadata that is explicitly requested as part of this request. If you decide that the mere fact of two pieces of content being the same is itself withholdable, then please redact it using a replacement identifier that encodes only the reason.


# Rolling updates

Please provide me with rolling (incremental) updates, rather than having the entirety of the request be blocked until fully completed.

Please preserve all responsive records that you currently hold, pending release, particularly ones that are currently held in electronic form or format.

Please prioritize rolling updates based on what is most readily available, i.e. such that you release as the greatest amount of records in the fastest time.


# Fee waiver

I request fee waiver, because
* Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit;
* this request is for public interest, non-commercial, journalistic purposes;
* EO 13526 requires you to already be automatically and systematically compiling and acting on the records in item 1, and to centrally store the records in items 1 & 2;
* I am requesting records to be provided exclusively in electronic format, with no paper copies, so you should incur no actual costs; and
* the President determined in EO 13526 that 10–25 year old classified records should be declassified, and the records requested would serve as an index for a follow-up request for all such records, to make them widely available.


# Request tracking numbers and estimated completion date

Upon receipt, and in every followup response, please state your tracking number(s) for this request, as well as your specific estimated completion date. 5 USC 552(a)(7).


Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your initial response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.
Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) tax-exempt corporation devoted to public interest journalism, government transparency and accountability, individuals' civil rights, and related issues.

P.S. My full legal name is just Sai. Please use no title for me.

title: Classification metadata for old records, and classification & declassification guides (Department of Housing and Urban Development)

communications.communication:
Dear Department of Housing and Urban Development,

On behalf of myself and Fiat Fiendum, I hereby request the following records under 5 USC 552(a)(3), as to your Department, including every component or otherwise associated agency, corporation, or other establishment of the executive branch within the meaning of 5 USC 552(f)(1):

1. for each record created before Jan. 1, 2016, that was ever classified in whole or in part, a CSV formatted spreadsheet of the following EO 13526 information:
a. a unique record identifier, and location information, sufficient to enable a FOIA officer to easily and precisely locate that record, and that is as descriptive as is feasible without disclosing classified information
b. the date the record was created
c. the classification level and codewords (e.g. "TS/SCI//FISA", "SECRET//ORCON/NOFORN", "TOP SECRET//COMINT//REL TO USA, FVEY",  or the like)
d. the identity of the original classification authority, including their personal identifier, agency, office, position, and name
e. the agency and office of origin
f. the date of original classification
g. the date or event for declassification per EO 13526 § 1.5(a), or the 10–25 year declassification date per § 1.5(b), as the case may be
h. the concise reason for classification
i. the applicable classifications categories from EO 13526 § 1.4
j. the  associated "classification guide" and/or "declassification guide" within the meaning of EO 13526 § 6.1(h) & (n), or if those are separate full documents rather than relatively short text, their record unique identifiers
k. EO 13526 § 1.6(a)(1)(D) information (in the case of information that should clearly and demonstrably be expected to reveal the identity of a confidential human source or a human intelligence source or key design concepts of weapons of mass destruction, the marking prescribed in implementing directives issued pursuant to EO 13526)
l. EO 13526 § 3.3(b), (c), (d), (g), (h), (i), & (j) information (automatic declassification exemption), including the particular subparagraphs claimed to be applicable, and the applicable details (such as explanations of exemption, date exempted, exempting authority, etc)
m. all other classification metadata, such as "derived from" markers (see e.g. EO 13526 § 2.1), foreign classifications (see e.g. EO 13526 § 1.6(e)), etc.
n. the FOIA identifiers of every request made which covered that record

2. all classification guides within the meaning of EO 13526 §§ 6.1(h), together with their unique record identifiers
3. all declassification guides within the meaning of EO 13526 §§ 6.1(n), together with their unique record identifiers


For item 1, to the extent that you are unable to narrow your search based on the age of the underlying records, please either substitute the text "created before Jan. 1, 2016" with "classified before Jan. 1, 2016" or ignore the text ", created before Jan. 1, 2016" — i.e. you may construe the relevant date as the date of classification rather than the date of record creation (if you don't have the latter but have the former), and you may have false positives (additionally disclosing the classification metadata of records that are from 2016 or later), but you may not have false negatives (failing to disclose exemptions about records that are from before 2016, e.g. because your search fails to include classification metadata about records whose creation date you didn't track).

To the extent that you do not have item 1 records in a spreadsheet or database format, please provide records that would most closely approximate it — i.e. comprising a bulk index of classification information that would be useful for making FOIA requests of records whose classification has expired — such as (in decreasing order of preference) records compiled for the purpose of conducting (or for the then-future conduction of) declassification or declassification review under EO 13526, such as §§ 3.3, 3.4, 3.5, or 3.6 automatic, systematic, or mandatory declassification; classification logs; record indices; record cover sheets; or the like.

This request has no time or subject limit whatsoever, other than that the cutoff date is the date of your search.

For all responsive records, I request:
a. all parts of the record (i.e. no portion of a record with some responsive portion may be considered "non-responsive")
b. all record metadata, such as dates on which they were drafted, passed, went into effect, withdrawn, or similar events; person(s) / office(s) responsible; authors; IDs; revision numbers; email headers; hyperlinks; structural metadata; email addresses; comments; revision history; timestamps; file names and contents; pagination or lack thereof; format specific metadata (e.g. particular to Word, PDF, or paper files); filing location, labeling, & organization; etc.
c. if any classification applies, mandatory declassification review (MDR) under E.O. 13526, and the result of the MDR, including any declassified records.



# Form & format

## Native email format & minimal redaction

Please provide all email records in EML, Maildir, or MBOX format only — not PDF, Word, image, etc — including all metadata (e.g. full email headers as received/sent) and attachments, without alteration other than narrowly tailored electronic redaction of specifically claimed exemptions that do not affect any part of non exempt information (and, in particular, without rasterization).

Please provide all other records in their original electronic format (if electronic), and as one 300dpi color scan PDF per logical document, staple, paperclip, or file folder (whichever is most narrow) if the original is in paper format.

Please note that FOIA requires you to service the maximum extent of my request that can be done via e.g. partial redaction of exempt material. If you believe some portions of a record to be exempt because it contains classified information (18 USC 798), please provide a version of the record redacted to the minimum extent necessary to remove exempt information, along with adequate information to describe the reason for each specific exemption, and without altering any non exempt information (including metadata).

## No new records; electronic & original format

This request does not ask you to create new records.

If you determine that a response would require creating a new record that you do not want to create, please first contact me by email with an explanation of what records you have that would most closely match the information requested and might be acceptable substitutes, so that we can reasonably tailor the request.

In particular, I specifically request that you do not create new documents in response to this request that are modifications of a digital record, such as page-view images, print views, scans, or the like. No such creation or substitution is authorized by FOIA.

However, if the same or similar records are held in both electronic and paper formats, this request includes both the paper and electronic versions. The paper version and the digital version are distinct records, and each may contain distinct information such as handwritten or other markings on the paper copy and embedded metadata in the electronic version. I specifically request both the original, electronic format record, and (if it contains any additional markings) the paper record.

To the extent that the original native electronic format is proprietary or otherwise not in format accessible by widely available, open source software, I also request
1. an export of the proprietary format into a standard, open format, and
2. all proprietary software and documentation necessary to use and understand the original, proprietary format records.

## Rehab Act § 508 compliance

I am partially blind. In accordance with 5 USC 552(a)(3)(B & C) (E-FOIA), Rehabilitation Act § 508, and the FOIA Improvement Act, I require that you respond using original, native format, electronic, machine-processable, accessible, open, and well structured records to the maximum extent possible — for both the content of your response, and any communications about the request (such as response letters).

Please make all correspondence pursuant to this request — including notification and responsive records — by email, with native electronic format records, as specified in the request. I do not authorize you to send anything to me by physical mail unless I specifically state otherwise.

Do not use any password on any files, including ZIP files etc., unless a password was present in the original, native format (in which case, leave it unaltered, and send me the password). Do not respond using ZixCorp "Secure Mail" or any other method that "expires" records from being available. Use only actual email and direct attachments, or upload using the link below, unless I explicitly request otherwise.

If there are any files you prefer not to transfer by email (e.g. if they are >10MB), please upload them to me via the link listed below my signature. Doing so is secure, completely free to you, and I will be notified of the upload.
